!By 
03/12/2016
President Barack Obama’s 2016 SXSW Keynote: Civic Engagement in the 21st Century \
==========================================================================================
After visiting Austin’s own  (where he ordered not only a "Democrat" taco but also a "Republican" and an "Independent" from the menu), **President Barack Obama** stepped onto the Long Center stage to join Editor-in-Chief of _The Texas Tribune_, **Evan Smith**, for a **2016 SXSW Keynote conversation**. Before any words were spoken, the audience rose for a standing ovation. He is the first sitting president to ever be part of the SXSW Conference & Festivals in Austin, TX.
President Obama and Evan Smith discussed a myriad of topics including **civic engagement in the 21st Century** before an audience of creators, early adopters, and entrepreneurs who are defining the future of our connected lives. During the Keynote, the President called on the SXSW audience as well as the tech industry at-large to help solve the nation’s biggest problems by working in conjunction with the United States government.
> #### "It’s not enough to focus on the cool, next big thing. It’s harnessing the cool, next big thing to help people in this country."
He also reminded the audience about the campaign that he ran on in 2008 saying, "The slogan wasn’t 'Yes, _I_ can' it was 'Yes, _we_ can,'" to encourage the attendees and live stream listeners around the country to make an impact in their communities.
Watch the entire . Discover more SXSW Keynotes, Featured Speakers and more on our .
Photo by Neilson Barnard/Getty Images for SXSW
...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: The official South by Southwest website provides information about the conference, including its history, events, and participants. However, while the site has accurate descriptions of the festival, it may not provide comprehensive coverage concerning news or events related to political figures, thus limiting its overall news credibility. It's a reliable source for event details but not necessarily for detecting fake news.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence clearly discusses President Obama’s keynote at SXSW on March 11, 2016, which coincides with Nancy Reagan's funeral. It indicates that he participated in the festival, providing direct context about his scheduling conflict with the funeral.

**South by Southwest** (**SXSW**) is an annual conglomeration of parallel , , and  and  "Convention (meeting)") organized jointly that take place in mid-March in . It began in 1987 and has continued growing in both scope and size every year. In 2017, the conference lasted for 10 days with the interactive track lasting for five days, music for seven days, and film for nine days. There was no in-person event in 2020 and 2021 as a result of the ;]] in both years there was a smaller online event instead.]
SXSW is run by the company SXSW, LLC, which organizes conferences, trade shows, festivals, and other events.] In addition to SXSW, the company runs the conference SXSW EDU and the SXSW Sydney festival (from 2023, in , Australia) and co-runs  in . It has previously run or co-run the events North by Northwest (1995–2001), West by Southwest (2006–2010), SXSW Eco (2011–2016),  (2013–2015), and the me Convention (2017–2019). In addition, a large number of other events, past and present, sometimes collectively referred to as...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Wikipedia is a collaborative encyclopedia that tends to provide well-sourced and documented information. The articles undergo community oversight, which helps maintain accuracy. However, reliability can vary by topic and contributor expertise. For political events and public figures, it usually offers a balanced view, making it a good resource for contextual information and cross-references but note that citations are crucial for validating its claims.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: While this entry provides a general overview of the SXSW festival, it does not directly address President Obama's attendance on the specific date of Reagan's funeral or the implications of that decision. It provides context about the festival's timing but lacks direct references to the claim.

clean_title.title: President Obama And The First Lady Will Be SXSW Keynotes

website_content.content:
! Photo by Mike Theiler-Pool/Getty Images.
For the first time since the conference launched in 1987, this year’s South By Southwest Festival will feature a sitting president and first lady.
President Barack Obama will have a conversation with the editor in chief of _The Texas Tribune_ on March 11, and First Lady Michelle Obama will discuss her  on March 16.
“I can’t imagine a better way to celebrate our event’s 30th year than to welcome both the President and First Lady to SXSW,” said festival co-founder Roland Swenson . “As each new generation comes up at SXSW they look for ways they can be of service, and it’s important to reflect and support that message. President and Mrs. Obama’s visit here will inspire attendees to that purpose.”
Unfortunately, the president’s speech happens on the same day as a panel near and dear to the first lady’s health-conscious interests—. Luckily SXSW features   panels.
The tech festival has become a go-to for  and . No word if the Obamas will stick around for , or if someone will disrupt the 
D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser will also be in attendance.
You haven't listened to any stories!
What's the hold up?
WAMU stopped publishing DCist.com in February 2024. You are viewing the site archive.

website_quality_evaluation.justification: DCist covers local news and events in Washington, D.C. While it has a good reputation for local journalism, its coverage of national events like presidential duties may not be as comprehensive or frequent. However, the site still provides accurate reporting related to D.C. happenings and can be reliable when covering relevant political news.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence specifically notes that both President and First Lady Obama were attending SXSW, with Barack's speaking engagement on March 11 occurring on the same day as Nancy Reagan’s funeral. This ties directly into the claim about his absence from the funeral.

Attend SXSW
===========
The SXSW® Conference & Festivals celebrate the convergence of the tech, film and television, and music industries. Located deep in the heart of Austin, Texas, SXSW is the premier destination for discovery. Explore SXSW registration options, badge access, and more.  
**Registration opens on August 6, 2024.**
Join Us at SXSW 2025
====================
Experience unparalleled discovery, learning, professional development, and networking with creatives from around the world at SXSW.

website_content.content:
[Content truncated]... you hope you have some shows that pay you to offset it. A lot of bands don’t.”
!
Juliet Tango perform on Red River during SXSW in Austin. Photograph: Lizzie Chen/The Guardian
Juliet Tango were playing in front of a waffle truck, having driven to Austin from Olympia, Washington – a distance of more than 2,000 miles. “We had a hell of a trip, we just got here this morning and rolled in on our last two dollars of gas,” said drummer Ripley Ty.
But was it worth it?
“Absolutely! We’re going to be playing out here tonight and tomorrow night and hopefully make enough gas money to get home.”
!
Blushhh Music is Mathew Knowles’ latest band on his music label, Music World. Photograph: Lizzie Chen/The Guardian
Further down Sixth Street we came across three young women in tracksuits painted with their logo, Blushhh Music. They were happy to have their photograph taken, but reacted to an interview request like Dracula confronted with a crucifix. All interview requests, I was informed, go through their manager, Mathew Knowles. They are Blushhh Music – in other words, proteges of Beyoncé’s dad. They gave the Guardian a poster.
!
Rapper Micky Munday from Los Angeles came down to Austin to perform during SXSW. This is his third time at the festival. Photograph: Lizzie Chen/The Guardian
Micky Munday was one of a number of rappers hanging out on the street – the LA native was set to play three shows including the Lit Lounge and the Eastern. “South by Southwest is dope,” he said. “It’s a beautiful thing. When you’re out here, everyone comes for new music, they come with open ears, so it’s a blessing.”
So how was he going down? “We rocking that motherfucker, man. We killing that shit. We’re jumping on couches and tables, kicking over drinks on the bar, spilling drinks on women, pouring champagne on ladies – you’ve got to do what you’ve got to do, man. We in the moment!”
!
Bud Wilmer and Linda McGuyer drove to Austin from Houston to check out the festival. Wilmer makes his own guitars. Photograph: Lizzie Chen/The Guardian
Bud Wilmer and Linda McGuyer were “just hanging out”, having driven here from Houston.
“We’ve got no plans, we’ll just see what happens.” Big music fans? “Who isn’t?” said Wilmer, a guitar maker. They’ve been to the festival before and like to people...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: The Guardian is a reputable news organization known for its investigative journalism and liberal viewpoints. It has a strong fact-checking process and generally provides well-researched and credible reporting on political issues, including actions taken by public figures. It would be highly valuable for assessing the truthfulness of claims about Obama’s decision regarding Reagan's funeral.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence talks about the festival environment and activities during SXSW but does not address President Obama's attendance or the funeral situation; therefore, it has minimal relevance to the claim.

# OPERATIONAL IMPACT $116.9M 
The scale and complexity of SXSW requires year-round operations. SXSW maintains a sizable staff of both full-time, temporary, and seasonal workers. 
# SXSW OFFICIAL ATTENDANCE IMPACT $159.7M 
The SXSW Official attendance impact includes expenditures by SXSW Credentialed & Official Participants and Single Ticket Holders at all Sanctioned SXSW events. 
# SXSW GUEST PASS & CONSUMER IMPACT $48.7M 
The SXSWeek attendance impact includes expenditures by SXSW Guest Pass & Consumer Participants as well as SXSWeek parties. 
# INDIRECT IMPACT $57.6M 
Indirect effects include increases in sales, income, and jobs associated with companies that benefit from SXSW expenditures. Increased revenue of a food distribution company that supplies products to SXSW’s caterer would be an indirect impact. 
# DIRECT IMPACT $220.1M 
Direct economic impacts include expenditures directly injected into the local economy by SXSW, official sponsors, event attendees, and exhibitors. A direct economic impact attributable to SXSW, for example, might include revenues from a catering...[Content truncated]

website_content.content:
!
You know a party’s a big deal when the president crashes.
When news broke that  would be attending this year’s South By Southwest festival in Austin, the Internet cracked jokes about the First Family crushing beers in sweaty clubs while watching one of the tiny indie bands that SXSW has attracted for 2-plus decades.
But 2016 is the year SXSW completes its transformation from a music festival into a cultural juggernaut. The Obamas are giving keynote addresses, Oscar-winning directors are premiering their movies, and brands are descending on the city to spend millions on sponsorships, swag and flashy stunts.
It’s easy to mourn the years where SXSW put independent art and music at its forefront, before Super Bowl levels of corporate mania (and corporate money) took over. , the festival is once again reasserting its importance to art, tech and civic engagement.
**The Obamas, getting real**: Obviously, the Obamas’ keynotes bookending the festival — Barack’s to open SXSW Interactive today; Michelle’s to close the festivities on March 16 — are the two most noteworthy. We’re looking forward to Obama’s speech about tech and civic engagement, and hopefully, at a conference more known for its buzzy app launches, he can galvanize the entrepreneurs in the room to do good. But more exciting is Michelle’s, where she’ll discuss her Let Girls Learn initiative and girls’ education. Her speech kicks off SXSW Music, coming at a time when the music industry’s sexism problem is now a national conversation. So we hope we hear echoes of feminism and gender equality in Michelle’s talk.
**The...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: USA Today is known for its straightforward reporting style and broad coverage of news topics. It has a reputation for factual reporting, though some might critique it for superficiality compared to other more in-depth news outlets. Still, it provides reliable information and has a good fact-checking record.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence discusses the festival's significance and hints at Obama’s presence but lacks detailed information about the schedule overlap with the funeral, thus earning it a low score.

SXSW 2016 Interactive Sessions
==============================
Data
SXSW 2016 Interactive Sessions
==============================
!
!
by Zack Gorman
//
March 9, 2016
Every March, the Tech world descends upon Austin for the . This year, SXSW is celebrating their 30th anniversary in a very big way with President Obama and the First Lady making an appearance in a pair of keynotes for the Interactive and Music festivals, respectively. While the ticket lottery has come and gone for Barack’s speech on Friday, there’s still thousands of sessions to pick through at the Interactive Conference.
In anticipation of attending SXSW last year,  to try and make some sense of it all, and it helped me have a really fantastic week (and the Lone Star’s didn’t hurt either). While I regrettably won’t be in attendance this year, I still wanted to help others fill up some of the holes in their SXSW schedule as efficiently as possible. Thanks to some changes in Tableau over the last 12 months, putting this dashboard together is easier than ever.
What’s The Same
---------------
I used the fabulous  again to scrape session information from the SXSW website and into a CSV to build the dashboard around. From there, I used Google Maps URLs to figure out the latitude and longitude of the new venues for the custom geocoding and the Noun Project to find a nice public domain building icon. As far as chart types, these are largely unchanged. So, what’s new besides some updated session information?
Custom Maps: Going from “10 Minutes or Less” to “30 Seconds Tops”
-----------------------------------------------------------------
I’ve made some visual changes this year, including changing some colors and fonts around to fit the new logo a little better. The big change, though, was being able to use native Mapbox support to jazz...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: InterWorks primarily specializes in data analytics and consulting. Although it may have useful insights into data-driven decision-making, it does not focus on news or current events, making it less reliable for truthfulness and fake news detection in the context of political claims.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence mentions the festival's sessions but does not provide specific information about Obama’s attendance or its conflict with the funeral.

Nancy Reagan: Obama will skip funeral for SXSW 2016 appearance
==============================================================
By
!:max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():format(webp)/70817573_10105500767504676_636282787673931776_n-e05f905a7b4c40c0aba6d1316fcb41b8.jpg)
*   
Jessica Derschowitz is the former digital features director at _Entertainment Weekly_. She left EW in 2022.
Published on March 8, 2016 10:39PM EST
!:max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():format(webp)/nancy-reagan-0a03db753f13415c9fc4c23c249e4346.jpg)
Photo: Harry Langdon/Getty Images
First lady Michelle Obama will be among the attendees at the funeral for Nancy Reagan on Friday, but President Barack Obama will not be joining her due to commitments at the South by Southwest Festival.
The president is scheduled to speak that day at SXSW,  reported Tuesday.
Festival organizers  that both of the Obamas would give speeches during the annual event in Austin, Texas. President Obama will kick off the 30th annual festival on Friday, marking the first time a sitting president will participate in the event. He is due to take part in a discussion on civic engagement with Evan Smith, editor in chief of _The Texas Tribune_, as a part of SXSW Interactive.
The first lady is also taking part in this year’s SXSW, but on a different day. She is scheduled to give the opening keynote address for SXSW Music on March 16 and will talk...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Entertainment Weekly focuses mainly on entertainment news, reviews, and pop culture. While it may occasionally cover political topics, it is not primarily a news organization and thus may not have the expertise or reliability needed to critically evaluate political claims or expose fake news.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence explicitly states that President Obama would skip Nancy Reagan's funeral to attend SXSW on March 11, confirming the claim directly and providing critical context regarding his scheduling decision and its implications.
